website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy hardshell bag with enough space for heavy packers and extended stays. It's built to last, and comes with an impressive warranty to back it.
pros: In addition to the deep 40-60 split interior that provides ample packing space, this well-made hardshell bag has a textured finish that resists scratching
Attractive, industrial look stands out on baggage claim conveyors
cons: Taller than similar hardshell bags, which makes it a bit awkward for some individuals to handle

customer_reviews.title: One Flight and destroyed
customer_reviews.text: On the first flight from DFW to JFK, then to Accra Ghana, brand new at DFW in great shape, huge hole in the side at Accra. VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED. WON'T BE BUYING ANOTHER AMIERICAN TOURISTER PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Coats

customer_reviews.title: Cute but damaged after only one use
customer_reviews.text: On my first trip with this luggage, the stitching around the zipper came undone and you could literally stick your fingers through the hole and into the bag when it was zipped up. This bag was SO cute, I tried to ignore the other reviews that said it wasn't durable. Should have listened.
customer_reviews.author: A Flume

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm...
customer_reviews.text: This was kind of long and skinny, certainly not like a regular suitcase. It's tall (31"), which led me to believe it's bigger than it was, but it really wasn't. My husband liked it, but for me, not so much. It's tall, but it only holds what a medium to small sized suitcase would hold.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Le Veque

customer_reviews.title: Too tall
customer_reviews.text: Too long and tall doesn’t meet an airline requirement size
customer_reviews.author: emerson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to carry some equipment for a trip to Japan. Well, I am pleased to announce that it made it to Japan and back without a scratch. Now I don't know if that's because of Air Canada's light handling or the trunk is heavy duty or not. I will say the construction is light, so it does not look like it would stand up to much abuse, but when closed up, it does feel pretty solid. After 1 trip, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: trip locker
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it is very lite weight. On the other hand the outer shell is thin and flimsy. I've used it once with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Duane Burbank

customer_reviews.title: Recommend - great suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product 5 months ago. Have flown and traveled by car with it several times. Everything inside has stayed protected and unbroken. Can hold LOTS!! Pleasantly surprised at all the room and pockets on the inside. With 4 wheels it is also much easier to maneuver. The case itself seems thin and bends easily. I thought it was going to be a little stronger. Handle is easy to pull up to push or drag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this suitcase except that it's a little heavier than I had hoped for. Nevertheless, I would buy it again and will definitely continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: MadeleineMatisse

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: MY HUSBAND RETIRED THE "PURPLE MONSTER" PRIOR TO OUR TRIP TO EUROPE FOR 2 WEEKS AND THIS WAS AN AMAZING SUITCASE FOR THE TRIP, A LONG WITH SOME TRAVEL CUBES AND I HAD MORE THAN ENOUGH ROOM AND WAS EVEN 10LBS UNDERWEIGHT FOR OUR FLIGHT, MORE ROOM FOR GIFTS:) I HIGHLY RECCOMEND!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve traveled both nationally and internationally. It holds up well to air travel. It holds a good amount and keeps things secure.
customer_reviews.author: papa bear

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as strong/sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice suitcase, came as expected. Only issue is that it is not as strong/sturdy as it seems. Might get damaged after couple of trips.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Not the size listed in listing
customer_reviews.text: Huge bummer- about to head out on a work trip and the suitcase is not the dimensions in the ad. Buyer be ware!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Warner

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of stuff
customer_reviews.text: I use this to travel with my chef gear. Plenty of room and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: david munson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have used this luggage multiple times since purchase. The luggage was able to hold items for 1 week travel for myself and my 3 month old granddaughter. I cant wait to use it for its original intended purchase, my upcoming trip to Fiji!! Love the color, I got the green!
customer_reviews.author: Amy O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bomber for the bucks
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's perfect for my needs on a week to ten day trip. If not totally abused by the baggage guys, this should last a long time. Could also smuggle a dwarf if the dwarf is small, but you couldn't leave him/her in there too long. That about sums it up.
customer_reviews.author: Fred F

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect specifications.
customer_reviews.text: The description said the suitcase was 21” wide. It was only 15” wide. Sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: H. Eddie Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Made a two connection flight to Paris is perfect shape. Color stood out on carousel and rolling across brick pavers was simple. Held 46.5 lbs. with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Nice tall and able to hold alot of items for trips.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Sutfin

customer_reviews.title: The snap-in mesh restraint for the deep side is missing.
customer_reviews.text: The snap-in mesh restraint for the deep side is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Eastvold

customer_reviews.title: 😡 💵 waste.
customer_reviews.text: I never received this product and neither was refunded for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bikkey shah

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty nice.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit smaller than the picture makes it out to be.....
customer_reviews.author: Parker stephens

customer_reviews.title: Extremely lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I liked the appearance of the case and the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Large and portable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. I was looking for a large portable suitcase, for traveling long distance. And this was great. I am not sure about the zip closure yet, until I have used it for some time. I also acquired some vacuum storage bags to increase the number of clothes...
customer_reviews.author: Howard L. Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Distinctive Appearance, Good Construction
customer_reviews.text: After trying many times to identify my luggage in the sea of airplane cargo (especially with 12 hour international flights), this trip locker is easy to locate. Its shape seems restrictive but holds about a decent week's worth. I think it has mostly to do with packing and the different configuration maybe causes baggage handlers to pay a little more attention. At least I can hope so. It does seems to roll better than other luggage whether from the larger wheels or narrower profile. It is a lighter luggage so time will tell how it holds up but the 10 year warranty is a good indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Bass Cadet

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This is much smaller than our normal suitcases that we take on our flights. The color is absolutely fabulous and we love it we just wish it was bigger.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than canvas/fabric but NOT a hardshell
customer_reviews.text: Green color is great and will be easy to find in baggage claim. Know that the exterior is plastic, but is NOT a hard shell. The plastic has some give to it. More protective of what you pack than canvas/fabric luggage will be, but not the level of sturdiness for throwing around in handling that you see in hard shell luggage. The zipper is hard to work around the curved edges. Insides fit lots of clothes for up to several weeks’ vacation. Interior organized well to help. The shape is very vertical and slim. Will go across a whole trunk of a smallish sedan. Definitely a bag to check.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Flexible
customer_reviews.text: The American Tourister Trip Locker Hardside Checked Luggage with Dual Spinner Wheels is of sturdy and flexible construction. The spinner wheels work smoothly, and the outside shell is hard yet flexible. The case is thin, and there is ample room for a week or two worth of outfits.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Well made with
customer_reviews.text: Well made, durable and I can see it lasting a long time. The only reason I don’t care for is the height. The height has positives, adding taller items to the bag. The con, it doesn’t fit easily when packing with our other luggage. Not a huge issue, but just something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Niedz

customer_reviews.title: Innovative & Attractive
customer_reviews.text: I love how this bag stands out. You will be able to identify it right away in the luggage line. Overall, and innovative suitcase. Very roomy and well-designed for it's size, and easy to maneuver. You can pack a lot into a mid-sized space.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Tall and skinny
customer_reviews.text: I dont feel like this is q true hardside. The plastic isnt stuff or rigid. Its doesnt feel durable. It's sort of thin. Its lightweight. Slim and tall. Doesnt hold as much as I thought it would. Rolls nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MyPenName

product_meta.title: American Tourister Trip Locker Hardside Checked Luggage with Dual Spinner Wheels, Silver, 31-Inch
product_meta.description: When the going gets tough, the tough get rolling. The Trip Locker luggage innovative 40/60 split construction offers deeper packing capacity on main compartment. FOUR exterior polypropylene lashing anchors for secure tie down during transit, debossed texture on surface provides scratch resistance. Rugged #10 main opening zipper with custom designed ergonomic zipper puller. Robust multi-stop handle system with telescopic push-button grip maximizes comfort and maneuverability. Over-size diameter dual spinner wheels offer smooth rolling and stability. The pull handle is engineered to extend to the right height for a comfortable, unobstructed grip so you can balance your morning pick-me-up in one hand, and your family’s cargo in the other
feature_bullets: INNOVATIVE 40/60 SPLIT Construction offers deeper packing capacity on main compartment
FOUR EXTERIOR POLYPROPYLENE lashing anchors for secure tie down during transit
DEBOSSED TEXTURE on surface provides scratch resistance
RUGGED #10 MAIN OPENING Zipper with custom designed ergonomic zipper puller
ROBUST MULTI-STOP HANDLE System with telescopic push-button grip maximizes comfort and maneuverability
OVER-SIZED DIAMETER DUAL SPINNER Wheels offer smooth rolling and stability
BODY DIMENSIONS: 31" X 12.25" X 14", OVERALL DIMENSIONS: 31.5" X 12.3" X 14.5", Weight: 15 lbs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars77 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
